content.body: Sounds like what they want is F# pipes or the ability to supply tacit unary functions. I still prefer F#-style, tbh, and I think it would have been easier to advance if we'd pushed back on supporting `await` and `yield` (e.g., `(await (x |> y)) |> z`) and just clarified the precedence of `|>` vs. `=>`
content.formatted_body: Sounds like what they want is F# pipes or the ability to supply tacit unary functions. I still prefer F#-style, tbh, and I think it would have been easier to advance if we'd pushed back on supporting await and yield (e.g., (await (x |> y)) |> z) and just clarified the precedence of |> vs. =>
